content.text:
# Draft:Quitasueño (Dominican Republic)

----
Quitasueño is a municipal district of the Dominican Republic, located in the province of Sánchez Ramírez and part of the municipality of Cotuí. This municipal district is home to the Hatillo Dam, one of the largest in the country, and also houses the Technological University of Eastern Cibao.
Quita Sueño is a municipal district belonging to the municipality of Cotuí, Sánchez Ramírez province. It was assigned this category by Law No. 218-05 on May 9, 2005. It is comprised of the communities of Las Cruces, La Estancia, and Los Transformadores. The district has a population of over 3,000.
In August 2021, the Municipal Palace was inaugurated, with 5% of the mining funds managed by the Provincial Council for the Administration of Sánchez Ramírez Mining Funds (FOMISAR).
